main event: A witness observed a meteor during a rare daylight sighting on April 9, 1950.
interesting points: The witness observed the meteor for about 10 seconds,The object had sharp outlines and moved at a velocity greater than 1,200 mph,This sighting is noted as an uncommon instance of a daylight meteor observation,The meteor was described as being extremely bright, potentially brighter than the full moon,The object disappeared over the horizon almost immediately after being seen.
witness description: A male USAF Information Services Officer aged 39 and his wife
